info.name: FXChrome Australis Style
info.description: This userstyle removes the background from unselected and pinned tabs and adds the thin separators from the default Australis theme. Hovering over unselected tabs will display a soft, red gradient background. This userstyle also changes the new tab button to a plus sign. This userstyle is designed to be used with the FXChrome theme only. Not only will it probably look weird on the default theme, but using it with the default theme would be kind of counterproductive, don't you think? ;)
info.additionalInfo: RELEASE HISTORY: 26 MAY 2014 - 0.1 - Initial Release KNOWN BUGS: 1. When the tab bar is completely full of tabs, the pinned tabs somehow get shoved upward. It looks weird and I don't yet know how to fix it. TESTING NOTES: This userstyle was tested in Firefox 29.0.1 on OS X 10.9.3 with version 30 of dkgo's FXChrome theme. I cannot guarantee that it will work on any other platform or Firefox version (if you're using anything earlier than Firefox 29.0, you should probably use dkgo's "UX-fxchrome style" userstyle). I also cannot guarantee that it will work on previous or future versions of the FXChrome theme. I'm kind of new to messing with Firefox's theming, so bear with me, please!
